introductionContent.text: Welcome to the second International Workshop on Predicting and Improving Text Readability for Target Reader Populations (PITR).

entities.text: International Workshop on Predicting and Improving Text Readability for Target Reader Populations (PITR)

introductionContent.text: The last few years have seen a resurgence of work on text simplification and readability.

Examples include learning lexical and syntactic simplification operations from Simple English Wikipedia revision histories, exploring more complex lexico-syntactic simplification operations requiring morphological changes as well as constituent reordering, simplifying mathematical form, applications for target users such as deaf students, second language learners and low literacy adults, and fresh attempts at predicting readability.

introductionContent.text: The PITR 2013 workshop has been organised to provide a cross-disciplinary forum for discussing key issues related to predicting and improving text readability for target users.

It will beheld on in conjunction with the 51st Conference of the Association for Computational Linguistics in Sofia, Bulgaria, and is sponsored by the ACL Special Interest Group on Speech and Language Processing for Assistive Technologies (SIG-SLPAT).

entities.text: ACL Special Interest Group on Speech and Language Processing

introductionContent.text: These proceedings include nine papers that cover various perspectives on the topic.
We hope this volume is a valuable addition to the literature, and look forward to an exciting Workshop.
